question_text: 25. Let A = {1, 2, 3}. The number of relations on A, containing (1, 2) and (2, 3), which are reflexive and transitive but not symmetric, is ______.
solution: Transitivity (1, 2)  R, (2, 3)  R  (1, 3)  R For reflexive (1, 1), (2, 2) (3, 3)  R Now (2, 1), (3, 2), (3, 1) (3, 1) cannot be taken therefore 3 relations are possible.

question_text: 65. Given below are two statements : Statement (I) : A spectral line will be observed for a 2p x  2p y transition. Statement  (II)  :  2p x  and  2p y  are  degenerate orbitals. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(1): Both Statement-I and Statement-II are true.
options.(2): Both Statement-I and Statement-II are false.
options.(3): Statement-I is true but Statement-II is false.
options.(4): Statement-I is false but Statement-II is true.

solution: No spectral line will be observed for a 2p x  2p y transition  because  2p x  and  2p y  orbitals  are degenerate orbitals.

question_text: 66. Given below are two statement : Statement  (I)  :  Nitrogen,  sulphur,  halogen  and phosphorus present in an organic compound are detected by Lassaigne’s Test. Statement  (II)  :  The  elements  present  in  the compound are converted from covalent form into ionic  form  by  fusing  the  compound  with Magnesium in Lassaigne’s test. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(1): Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.(2): Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.(3): Statement I is true but Statement II is false
options.(4): Statement I is false but Statement II is true

solution: The  elements  present  in  the  compound  are converted from covalent form into ionic form by fusing the compound with sodium in Lassigne’s test

question_text: 67. Identify the homoleptic complex(es) that is/are low spin. (A)[Fe(CN) (B)[CoF 5NO]2– 6]3– (C)[Fe(CN) 6]4– (D)[Co(NH 3) 6]3+ (E)[Cr(H 2O) 6]2+ Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
solution: (A)  [Fe(CN)   Heteroleptic, 5NO]–2  Fe+2,  3d6, t 2g6e g0, d2sp3, Low spin (3d series + SFL) (B) [CoF   Homoleptic,  High  spin, 6]–3  sp3d2, Co+3, 3d6 (3d series + WFL) (C)[Fe(CN) 6]–4  Homoleptic Fe+2, 3d6, d2sp3, t 2g6 eg0  Low spin (3d series + SFL) (D) [Co(NH 3) 6]+3  Homoleptic, Co+3  3d6, d2sp3, t 2g6 eg0, Low spin (3d series + SFL) (E)[Cr(H 2O) 6]+2  Homoleptic Cr+2  3d4, d2sp3, High spin t 2g3 e g1 (3d series + WFL)

question_text: 69. Given below are two statements : Statement (I) : Corrosion is an electrochemical phenomenon in which pure metal acts as an anode and impure metal as a cathode. Statement (II) : The rate of corrosion is more in alkaline medium than in acidic medium. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(1): Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.(2): Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.(3): Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.(4): Statement I is true but Statement II is false

question_text: 70. The  alkane  from  below  having  two  secondary hydrogens is :
solution: Alkane  2°H

question_text: 4.  4 2° 2° SECTION-B

71. The  compound  with  molecular  formula  C 6H 6, which gives only one monobromo derivative and takes  up  four  moles  of  hydrogen  per  mole  for complete hydrogenation has _______  electrons. NTA Ans. (8)
solution:  Monobromo derivatives Br No. of e– = 8 CH CH–Br 2 CH CH 2 2 2 2 CH CH  Monobromo derivatives N.of e– = 6

question_text: 72. Niobium (Nb) and ruthenium (Ru) have “x” and “y”  number  of  electrons  in  their  respective  4d orbitals. The value of x + y is _______
73. The complex of Ni2+ ion and dimethyl glyoxime contains ______ number of Hydrogen (H) atoms.
solution: [Ni(dmg) 2] CH 3–C=N  N=C–CH CH 3–C=N  N=C–CH Ni O–H--------O– O–-------H–O 3 3 Number of H-atom = 14

75. 20 mL of 2 M NaOH solution is added to 400 mL of 0.5 M NaOH solution. The final concentration of  the  solution  is  ______  ×  10–2  M.  (Nearest integer).
